menuData.name: Arancini
menuData.description: A delicious, breaded and deep-fried morsel of creamy risotto

menuData.name: Tarongia
menuData.description: This classic Sicilian flatbreaad is fried then grilled to create a beautifully crisp and indulgent starter. Topped with fennel, anchovies, chilli, pecorino, and onion.

menuData.name: Como Piccolo with Pesto alla Trapanese
menuData.description: A small loaf of Italian-style bread with an almond and tomato-based alternative to traditional Ligurian pesto.

menuData.name: Coniglio alla Stimpirata
menuData.description: Sweet and sour rabbit atop a bed of tender vegetables. Served at room temperature in warm weather.

menuData.name: Pasta con le Sarde
menuData.description: A true taste of Siciily. Sardines are foundational to the cuisine of this Italian aisle. This classic dish consists of a simplistic combination of sardines, pine nuts, and raisins.

menuData.name: Pasta alla Norma
menuData.description: Boccole noodles studded with golden aubergine. This dish uses a rich tomato sauce and is topped with shavings of ricotta salata.

menuData.name: Nero D'Avola
menuData.description: A popular red wine characteristic of Sicily. The grapes are though to have originated near Syracuse but are now grown throughout the region.

menuData.name: Marsala
menuData.description: The western town of Marsala is known for many things, but its eponymous dessert wine shines above the rest. A blend of white grape varietals make for a light, sweet, and satisfying experience.

menuData.name: Espresso
menuData.description: A shot of espresso to kickstart your post-dinner digestion and wake you up for the long night of mirth to come.

contactData.social: Follow us on social media for menu updates and showcases.
